main event: A bright, red-orange object was observed moving in a straight line across the sky in Cleveland, Ohio on December 7, 1958.
interesting points: The object was first observed in the southwest and moved in a straight line to the northeast, disappearing from sight.
The object appeared to be about the size of a small aircraft.
The object moved in a straight line at a steady speed.
The weather conditions at the time were slight haze with some clouds.
The witness, a private citizen, was able to observe the object for about 30 seconds before it disappeared from sight.
